page.title: 03Newton-on-Ouse.
page.content: Newton-on-Ouse is a small,well-kept village,centred round a church.The road from the A19 to Linton-on-Ouse passes through part of the village, with houses on both sides of the road.The Methodist Church,Primary School and several houses overlook a small green,on which grow a chestnut tree,two lime trees and a cherry tree. Cherry Tree Avenue,with its grass verges planted with cherry trees and bulbs,leads to the Lodge Gates,one of the entrances to Beningbrough Hall, National Trust property.Recent housing development has taken place along Back Lane,which connects Newton-on-Ouse to Beningbrough village.Seats in the village provide pleasant places to relax. The village area was once part of the Royal Forest of Galtres,about 1639 disafforested and enclosed in 1758.
